fr:frontmatter.fr:title: SGA 1: Étale covers and the fundamental group › Étale morphisms › Invariance properties › First proof

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: We use the following necessary and sufficient condition for a local Noetherian ring A of dimension \neq0 to be normal.

html:ol.html:li: For every rank-1 prime ideal \mathfrak {p} of A, A_ \mathfrak {p} is normal (or, equivalently, regular);
For every rank-\geq2 prime ideal \mathfrak {p} of A, the depth of A_ \mathfrak {p} is \geq2. (cf. EGA IV 5.8.6.)

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: We assume this criterion here, but it should also appear in the section on flatness. Its main advantage is that it does not suppose a priori that A is reduced, nor a fortiori that A is integral. Here, we can already suppose that \dim A= \dim B \neq0.

By the statements at the start of this section, the rank-1 (resp. rank-\geq2) prime ideals \mathfrak {p} of A are exactly the intersections of A with the rank-1 (resp. rank-\geq2) prime ideals \mathfrak {q} of B. Finally, if \mathfrak {p} and \mathfrak {q} correspond to one another, then B_ \mathfrak {q} is étale over A_ \mathfrak {p}, and thus of the same depth as A_ \mathfrak {p}, and is regular if and only if A_ \mathfrak {p} is (by ). Applying Serre's criterion, we see that A is normal if and only if B is.
